text: Best Ribs and chicken I've ever had.  The restaurant looks like it was built in the 70's, and so do the staff ;)  Great sign that they have been doing this for a long time, the food is great but a very limited menu.  BBQ chicken and ribs...that's it!  My fave were the ribs, smokey and really good, the spicy sauce on the side is a good change from all the sweet ribs.  If you want to get a seat during lunch or dinner, expect an hour wait.  I usually head straight for the take out counter.

Meilleur poulet et que dire des côtes levées.  Tout est cuit sur du vrai charbons de bois. C'est succulent et ils servent de bonnes portions. Les prix sont plus que raisonnable et le service est rapide une fois attablés car il y a souvent une file d'attente .

went there 3 adults and a 2 year old child, we all tried both chicken and ribs and you cant ask for a better deal for what you get. Price is Very reasonable especially the (family special) the chicken is great, the ribs fall off the bone. Waitresses are very nice mature women. feels like an old diner inside with only booths (banquettes) from what i saw but Very clean.  i live 10 minute walk away and was my first time there.  we will definitely be going back.

I did a search on YELP for a restaurant that was open near me. It was dark and seem to be away from most things. Parking was plenty and when my husband and I entered the restaurant the staff were very friendly. I was also happy to see the menu was in both English and French. My husband and I both ordered the Chicken Poutine which was very good. Most of the meals consisted of chicken (my favorite meat).  As for the restaurant, it was more of a Mom and Pop Family restaurant with a country feel. One of the workers was continuously cleaning everything in sight to include the windows, tables, counters etc which gave me a good feeling the workers take pride in the restaurant.   The food prices were very reasonable and serving were large. I would recommend sharing a plate if you aren't starving. We got a to go box and it was basically a meal after combining our leftovers. So, yes I would definitely recommend this Restaurant des Jardiniere.

First thing to mention is that their prices are the best. A bit more than 7$ (TX incl) for a repas cuisse. The chicken is really good but their fries are even better. We are not talking about mcdo frozen fries here. The only down side and the reason why they are no getting a 5 stars are the ribs. They are well cooked but the sauce on it is not great: basically a thick bbq sauce with not much flavor. I would still recommend eating there.

Je peux pas croire que ce restaurant est là depuis 36 ans et que j'y avais pas été avant février dernier!!!  Fait que 2e visite mercredi dernier avec maman. File d'attente pour la salle à manger et file d'attente pour les commandes à emporter... Un mercredi soir - dans une petite rue de LaPrairie, peux-tu croire?  Bon c'est quand même une petite place, genre 50-60 places assises, look des années 80 (brun, bois et beige) et très propre. On était pas assises qu'on avait nos verres d'eau et trois minutes après la serveuses, qui est là depuis toujours, prenait notre commande. On a chacune prix, soupe au poulet et nouilles et un quart cuisse! 2 minute après on avait nos soupes et breuvages! Ça chôme pas aux Jardiniers.  Ils sont vraiment reconnus pour leur poulet, et maintenant on sait pourquoi! Le poulet était vraiment juteux et délicieux, les patates frites étaient réellement des patates maison et la sauce.. je me suis retenue de la boire à la fin! (on va se garder une petite gêne) La soupe était aussi délicieuse, mais j'ai pas trippé sur la salade de choux crémeuse. Maman a pris la traditionnelle, que j'ai trouvé meilleure.  Notre combo: Soupe, Poulet, patates, pain, sauce, salade de choux et breuvage: 8,55$ (pas de frais supplémentaires pour changer les frites en salade verte) Les prix sont vraiment vraiment pas chers. Le quart cuisse tout seul est 6,55$  On retrouve pas ça souvent de nos jours. Surtout que c'est franchement bon.  Pour dessert, nous avons partagé la tarte au sucre chaude... C'était une tarte au sucre maison.. pis OH MYYYYY... sacrilège!!!! 2,50+1,25 pour une boule de crème glacée à la vanille... C'était du vrai bonheur, ça goûtait comme la tarte au sucre de grand-maman!  En tout cas, si je vous ai pas encore convaincu à y aller... svp recommencez votre lecture!!!
Great prices for BBQ chicken and ribs. A south shore classic located in the La Prairie farmers market. No credit cards or Interac accepted. Expect a line, however takeout orders are faster.

I ordered Demi-côtés levées, $11.95. It included a noodle and chicken soup, a coleslaw, fries, demi rib, a Pepsi. I went there Saturday evening. Service is good and family type ambiance. I'll be back soon.
visit montreal and came to this place, the checken and ribs are high recommended. we ordered full black ribs and 2 checken legs for me and my daughter.

Ce restaurant ouvert depuis 1982 est une institution à Laprairie. Poulet et côte levée sur charbon de bois. Prix variant de $8.00 à $25.00 pour le familiale qui inclut soupe breuvage frites poulet salade de choux. Difficile a trouver mieux qualité /prix. Preparez vous a attendre en ligne car l endroit est petit et toujours bondé mais l attente vaut le coup
